title: Critical NVIDIA Container Toolkit Flaw Allows Privilege Escalation on AI Cloud Services
summary:
Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed a critical container escape vulnerability in the NVIDIA Container Toolkit that could pose a severe threat to managed AI cloud services.
The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-23266, carries a CVSS score of 9.0 out of 10.0. It has been codenamed NVIDIAScape by

title: CERT-UA Discovers LAMEHUG Malware Linked to APT28, Using LLM for Phishing Campaign
summary:
The Computer Emergency Response Team of Ukraine (CERT-UA) has disclosed details of a phishing campaign that's designed to deliver a malware codenamed LAMEHUG.

title: Google Sues 25 Chinese Entities Over BADBOX 2.0 Botnet Affecting 10M Android Devices
summary:
Google on Thursday revealed it's pursuing legal action in New York federal court against 25 unnamed individuals or entities in China for allegedly operating BADBOX 2.0 botnet and residential proxy infrastructure.

title: From Backup to Cyber Resilience: Why IT Leaders Must Rethink Backup in the Age of Ransomware
summary: With IT outages and disruptions escalating, IT teams are shifting their focus beyond simply backing up data to maintaining operations during an incident. summary: OpenAI's next foundational and state-of-the-art model, GPT-5, is still on its way after a delay. OpenAI won't tell us the release date for now. [...]

title: Poor Passwords Tattle on AI Hiring Bot Maker Paradox.ai
